body:
Further investigation: This appears to happen when the entire app is prerendered. When prerendered, we end up with empty `nodes` and `routes`, but if there's at least one page not prerendered, `nodes[0]` exists and can display our custom error page.

(Side note: This actually means the `+error.svelte` in the template is broken in production as well, because the whole app is prerendered ðŸ˜¬)

This is a regression that came in through #13379 - in there, I adjusted the server manifest to not reference the root error/layout in case there are zero routes. That bites us here - not sure if we should just revert that specific check because we always will need it, or if there's a separate option we need to introduce there. We could also revert that part as it's "just" an optimization to not load more than needed.

issue.title: fix: Always include root layout/error nodes in manifest
issue.body:
Closes https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/13518.

This optimization doesn't work when an app (or a specific bundle, such as the ones generated for edge functions or when split: true in Vercel) has all prerendered routes. Given that the optimization probably isn't actually saving us much, it's probably not worth it to try to find some convoluted workaround.

TODO: Best way to test? Probably create a new app to guarantee it always has 0 non-prerendered routes.

---

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [x] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [x] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [x] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. Changesets that add features should be `minor` and those that fix bugs should be `patch`. Please prefix changeset messages with `feat:`, `fix:`, or `chore:`.

### Edits

- [x] Please ensure that 'Allow edits from maintainers' is checked. PRs without this option may be closed.

issue.title: Prerender causes 500 error
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Hi,

Using prerender in +layout.js and +error.svelte with adapter-node causes the following 500 error

### Reproduction

npx sv create my-app
> SvelteKit minimal
> Yes, using JavaScript with JSDoc comments
> sveltekit-adapter
> node
> npm

Create /src/routes/+layout.js with `export let prerender = true`
Create /src/routes/+error.svelte

npm run build
node build

Navigate to http://localhost:3000/testing which should cause the 404 page to appear.

### Logs

```Shell
TypeError: manifest._.nodes[0] is not a function
    at respond_with_error (file:///C:/Users/user/Desktop/myapp/build/server/index.js:5204:53)
    at resolve2 (file:///C:/Users/user/Desktop/myapp/build/server/index.js:6456:22)
    at resolve (file:///C:/Users/user/Desktop/myapp/build/server/index.js:6297:34)
    at init_promise.#options.hooks.handle (file:///C:/Users/user/Desktop/myapp/build/server/index.js:6531:71)
    at respond (file:///C:/user/flyn/Desktop/myapp/build/server/index.js:6295:43)
```

### System Info

```Shell
System:
    OS: Windows 11 10.0.26100
    CPU: (20) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-10900K CPU @ 3.70GHz
    Memory: 75.51 GB / 127.85 GB
  Binaries:
    Node: 22.14.0 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.EXE
    npm: 11.1.0 - ~\AppData\Roaming\npm\npm.CMD
  Browsers:
    Edge: Chromium (133.0.3065.69)
    Internet Explorer: 11.0.26100.1882
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-node: ^5.2.11 => 5.2.12
    @sveltejs/kit: ^2.16.0 => 2.17.3
    @sveltejs/vite-plugin-svelte: ^5.0.0 => 5.0.3
    svelte: ^5.0.0 => 5.21.0
    vite: ^6.0.0 => 6.2.0
```

### Severity

annoyance

### Additional Information

_No response_

body:
Does anyone else still have this issue?
I get the default vercel NOT_FOUND page instead of the svelte error page.
Please open a new issue with a reproduction if you're seeing this issue!
